results.title: The Sociological perspective: social class: work (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken Patton, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Compares social class positions and values of two contrasting occupations - engine drivers and architects. It shows several drivers and a London architect at work and talking about their work.

results.title: The Social drinker and the anti-social driver
results.creator_credit: Jim Tartan, Charles Cahill and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Statistical analysis of many automobile accidents involving drinking drivers, suggests the concept that it may not be the problem drinker that is primarily responsibile for most accidents on the road, but rather the social drinker.

results.title: The Snowy owls of Shetland
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clay and Royal Society for the Protection of Birds
results.brief_description: The first breeding record for the snowy owls in Britain is recorded at Fetlar, in the Shetland Isles off the coast of Scotland. This film is a record of the birds whilst being guarded by the members of the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds.

results.title: The Snowy Mountain Scheme: the first achievement
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Jean Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Reports on the initial preparations and planning in the Snowy Mountains region and the completion of the first project of the scheme - the Guthega project. Construction of the Guthega Dam and Munyang power station was begun and despite the difficulty of a cold climate, the project was completed and the power house officially opened by the Prime Minister, Mr Menzies, on 23 April 1955.

results.title: The Snowy day
results.creator_credit: Mal Wittman, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: The silent wonder of city snow and Peter’s delight in it as he slides down snow mountains and takes a snowball home in his pocket are told in exquisite collages that reflect the sparkling quality of snow and the contrasting warmth of the home and family. Narrated by Jane Harvey.

results.title: The Snowy : A Dream of Growing Up
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Siobhan McHugh and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Australia’s Snowy Mountains Scheme is one of the world’s greatest engineering feats. The project to bring water to the dry west was built between 1949 and 1974, employing 100,000 people, many of them migrants who brought with them changes that have shaped Australia. This film documents Australia’s ambitious project using interviews and historical film. Based on the book “The Snowy : the People Behind the Power” by Siobhan McHugh.

constellations_other.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_other.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

results.title: The Snowman (K)
results.creator_credit: Dianne Jackson, John Coates and Snowman Enterprises
results.brief_description: A young boy dreams that his snowman comes to life. Together they share the perils and joys of winter. This animated film uses muted pastels coupled with an exquisite orchestral score to make this non-verbal Christmas tale an experience for all seasons. Based on the book by Raymond Briggs.

results.title: The Snow is black = La Neige est noire
results.brief_description: Boy scouts go to the Alps to learn how to ski and to build their confidence. They are taught the techniques of skiing and the idea of group cooperation and friendship. In French with no subtitles.

results.title: The Snails = Le'escargots
results.creator_credit: Rene Laloux and Societe des Films d'Art et de Culture
results.brief_description: An animated story about man’s inability to learn from his mistakes. A market gardener’s plants are dying and his tears revive the plants, but snails quickly appear, consume his crop, and become mammoths. They move about destroying all, but the city is rebuilt and the cycle begins again.
